actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.

actions.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-47.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 30.
Mr. Hefley asked unanimous consent to discharge the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent.
RESERVATION OF OBJECTION - The House proceeded with debate under a reservation of objection.
On passage Passed without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. With written report No. 107-74.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 176.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 107-59.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands

official_title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of designating the Great Falls Historic District in Paterson, New Jersey, as a unit of the National Park System, and for other purposes.
short_title: Great Falls Historic District Study Act of 2001

summary.text: Great Falls Historic District Study Act of 2001 - Requires the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of designating the Great Falls Historic District in Paterson, New Jersey, as a unit of the National Park System.Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Great Falls Historic District Study Act of 2001
Great Falls Historic District Study Act of 2001
Great Falls Historic District Study Act of 2001

To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of designating the Great Falls Historic District in Paterson, New Jersey, as a unit of the National Park System, and for other purposes.
